question: For the Monty Hall problem, does it matter if you switch doors?

answers.answer: No. The car is behind any door with probability ${}^1{\mskip -2.5mu/\mskip -1mu}_3$
Yes. The host has eliminated a goat. The probability of selecting the car is now ${}^1{\mskip -2.5mu/\mskip -1mu}_2$
Yes. Switching can increase the probability of selecting the car to stricly more than ${}^1{\mskip -2.5mu/\mskip -1mu}_2$
No. Switching reduces the probability of selecting the car
